results.title: Arsenic and old lace
results.creator_credit: Frank Capra, Russel Crouse, Howard Lindsay and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In this black comedy, Cary Grant plays Mortimer Brewster, a drama critic about to marry Elaine Page (Priscilla Lane) who discovers that insanity runs in his family. His maiden aunts poison lonely old men, and his uncle buries the victims in the cellar. Mortimer attempts to conceal these crimes as police search for the murderer. Grant donated his fee to war relief.

results.title: Maytime
results.creator_credit: Robert Z Leonard, Hunt Stromberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Jeanette MacDonald stars as Marcia, an opera singer in Paris who falls in love with a penniless American voice student (Nelson Eddy). Unfortunately she has just accepted a marriage proposal from an egocentric voice teacher, Nazaroff, played by John Barrymore. Years later, when chance reunites the two lovers, the enraged Nazaroff grants them their freedom… but in his own way.

results.title: Adam's rib
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Katharine Hepburn plays Amanda Bonner, the defence attorney in the trial of Doris Attinger for the attempted murder of her husband whom she discovers has a mistress. Spencer Tracy is Amanda’s husband, Adam, prosecuting attorney in the same trial. As the trial progresses, Amanda and Adam find they cannot confine their battle to the courtroom, as the issues of sexual equality extend into their home. Also starring Judy Holliday and Tom Ewell.

results.title: The Bounty
results.creator_credit: Roger Donaldson, Bernard Williams, De Laurentiis Entertainment Group and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A re-telling of the famous conflict between Captain Bligh and Mr. Fletcher Christian aboard the ship “The Bounty”. The conflict eventually led to a mutiny against Bligh, led by Christian, and to Bligh’s miraculous escape in an open boat across 4,000 miles of ocean. Featuring beautiful Pacific locations and a star-studded cast including Daniel Day Lewis, Edward Fox and Laurence Olivier. Mel Gibson plays Christian. But it is Anthony Hopkins’ portrayal of Bligh which is most memorable and he makes the Captain a believably human character rather than the monster he is usually portrayed as. Music by Vangelis. The script is by Robert Bolt based on the book “Captain Bligh and Mr Christian” by Richard Hough.

results.title: Under Milk Wood
results.creator_credit: Andrew Sinclair, Jules Buck, Hugh French and Timon Films
results.brief_description: Based on the radio play by Dylan Thomas, this film weaves a tapestry of words around the lives and dreams of the inhabitants of the tiny Welsh village of Llareggub. Cast includes Richard Burton as the first voice, Elizabeth Taylor as Rosie Probert and Peter O’Toole as Captain Cat.

results.title: Jezebel
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Henry Blanke and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: On the eve of the Civil War, Julie Marston, a wilful southern belle, does everything in her spiteful power to goad her fiance into a jealous rage. When he is stricken by the plague, she reforms and tries to atone her wicked and sinful ways. Starring Henry Fonda and Bette Davis in her second Best Actress Academy Award performance. Based on the play by Owen Davis Sr.

results.title: Terror by night
results.creator_credit: Roy William Neill and Universal Studios
results.brief_description: Sherlock Holmes and Watson find themselves aboard the London-Edinburgh Express, guarding the priceless “Star of Rhodesia” diamond. A series of murders leads them on a trail confused by disguise and impersonation. Starring Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce. Adapted from a story by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

results.title: The Prince and the pauper (1937)
results.creator_credit: William Keighley, Robert Lord and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Tudor London, Edward IV, Price of Wales, is only thirteen years old, yet he is heir to the throne. For amusement, he changes his clothes with Tom, a pauper, who bears an uncanny resemblance to him. Circumstances, however, conspire to turn their childish prank into a dangerous game. Stars Errol Flynn and Claude Rains. Based on the novel by Mark Twain.

results.title: To Be or Not to Be
results.creator_credit: Ernst Lubitsch, Alexander Korda and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A Warsaw theatre group, before and during the Nazi invasion, wages war on Hitler on a devious new battleground - the Shakespearean stage. The actors improvise an underground plot and an impersonation of invading Nazis, including Adolf Hitler. Stars Jack Benny, Robert Stack and Carole Lombard in her final performance.

results.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
results.creator_credit: Robert Hamer, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A genteel mass-murderer is out to heartlessly eliminate the eight relatives standing between him and the family fortune. Alec Guinness plays all eight victims in this witty black comedy. Based on the novel “Noblesse oblige” by Roy Horniman.
